basics.name: Alberto Espinosa de los Monteros
basics.label: Computer Science Student
basics.summary: A passionate Computer Science student at the University of Colorado Boulder, specializing in software development, robotics, embedded systems, data science, and computer architecture. With a diverse skill set and hands-on project experience, I am eager to apply my knowledge in the professional world.

skills.name: Embedded & Robotics Frameworks
keywords: ADAS technologies (LiDAR, Radar, Computer Vision, RRT, ML, SLAM, IK)

work.name: Fully Autonomous Robot in Python
work.summary: Programmed a TIAGo Robot to autonomously scan, map, and retrieve objects from a simulated 3D supermarket using LiDAR-based mapping.
highlights: Developed a 2D map representation for navigation and path planning.
Implemented Color Blob Detection for object identification.
Applied RRT algorithm for optimal path computation.
Controlled the robot's arm using Inverse Kinematics for object retrieval.

work.name: EDA on Smoking Habits in the UK in Python
work.summary: Conducted exploratory data analysis on smoking habits using Python, uncovering insights on categorical and numerical variables.
highlights: Visualized relationships using NumPy, Pandas, Seaborn, and Matplotlib.
Delivered statistical insights on smoking trends.

work.name: STM32 Board Project in C++
work.summary: Developed a Tic-Tac-Toe game on the STM32F429i Discovery Board, integrating peripherals via HAL, external interrupts, and timers.
highlights: Designed an intuitive user interface for the game.
Created an AI opponent with RNG-based logic.

work.name: UDP Client-Server Connection in C
work.summary: Developed a UDP-based client-server system replicating core FTP functionalities, enabling file management.
highlights: Implemented reliable UDP communication with packet retransmission and error handling.
Optimized file transmission for large files.

work.name: RISC-V ISA Processor Modeling in CodAL
work.summary: Modeled instruction-accurate RISC-V processor with core instructions, pipeline forwarding logic, and memory operations.
highlights: Resolved data hazards using pipeline forwarding.
Ensured cycle-accurate models for performance-critical operations.
